alert.note: Alert for Banks (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 10:08PM EDT until September 10 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Banks County in northeastern Georgia... * Until 415 AM EDT Sunday. * At 1008 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen since 8 PM with rainfall rates of 1.5 to 3 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Homer, Lula, Maysville, Gillsville, Hollingsworth and Pinefield Crossroads. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
